## R markdown formatting

The final proposal will only be accepted as a Word output created from an R markdown file. Please use the template provided by clicking on the icon below.

For further information about the R markdown framework and options, some resources are provided below:

1. go through the *optional extra credit* R markdown module on [data.camp](https://datacamp.com/)

2. check out the course section on R markdown in the [Guides](/resources/Rmarkdown/) section

3. review over the R markdown section in [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/r-markdown.html). For a comprehensive guide to R markdown, take a look at the [R markdown Cookbook](https://bookdown.org/yihui/Rmarkdown-cookbook/)

4. use an external resource like [StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47710427/how-to-show-code-but-hide-output-in-Rmarkdown)

5. reach out for assistance over our course [Slack](https://2021edp693g.slack.com) site

### Structure

The proposal parallels a mixture between a prospectus and formal declaration of intent. A greater level of detail here will likely make it easier to complete your final paper.

<center>
```{r sub_tab, echo=FALSE}

slackico <- as.character("/logos/slack-ico.png{width=20px}")

wvuico <- as.character("/logos/wvu-blue-ico.png{width=20px}")

tibble(
  
   description <- c("Construct a one paragraph case for a population^[Note that a population does not necessarily imply people]. The narrative must address
                    
1. that needs to be researched or evaluated, 

2. why it should be be studied, and 

3. how the data is a good fit for a network analysis"),
  
  limitation <- c(
    "The entire body should be short and succinct not exceeding a single paragraph. Please refrain from rehasing definitions, methoidologies, etc.; rather address them and discuss the underlying reason to why you are use them and what you expect to occur."
  ),
  
  submit <- c(
    "Word as described preferably in a `docx` format."
  ),

  link <- c(
    paste0("[![",wvuico,"](/logos/wvu-blue-ico.png 'WVU Blue Icon'){width=30px}]",
    "(https://ecampus.wvu.edu){target='_blank'}"
    )
  ),
  
  .name_repair = "minimal"
  
) %>%
  kbl(col.names = c("Description", "Limitations", "What to Provide", "Where to Submit^[You may click on the icon to get connected]"), 
      "html", 
      escape = FALSE,
      align = 'lllc') %>%
  kable_styling(full_width = FALSE) %>%
  column_spec(1, width = "50em") %>%
  column_spec(2, width = "30em") %>%
  column_spec(3, width = "30em") %>%
  column_spec(4, 
              width = "10em",
              extra_css = 'vertical-align: middle !important;') %>%
  row_spec(0, extra_css = 'vertical-align: middle !important;') 
```
</center>

There is a soft limited submission deadline on November 14 at 11:59 PM. A 24 hour grace period is given but that allowance implies that late submissions will receive a 50% reduction. All submissions after 24 hours will effectively be given a 0%.
